CAREERS PRIVACY NOTICE

Privacy Notices for U.S. Applicants

Depending on where you reside in the U.S., a different applicant privacy notice applies to you. If you reside in California, please review the California Applicant privacy notice further down below. If you are residing elsewhere in the U.S., please review the Applicant Privacy Notice immediately below.

Careers Privacy Notice (Non-California)

Effective Date: June 30, 2017

Introduction

This Careers Privacy Notice (“Privacy Notice”) describes the handling of personal information obtained about job applicants through the Hearst online recruitment system and careers pages which link to this Privacy Notice (collectively, the “Recruitment System”). This Privacy Notice applies to personal information submitted through the Recruitment System directly by job applicants as well as by third party agencies and recruiters on behalf of applicants. This Privacy Notice describes the practices of the Hearst entity to which you are applying for a job opening and its affiliates, subsidiaries and related companies (collectively, “Hearst,” “we,” “us” or “our”).

What Personal Information We Obtain

Information You Give Us (or Others Give Us on Your Behalf)

If you choose to apply for a job opening or create a profile in the Recruitment System, we obtain the personal information you submit in connection with your application or profile creation. This information may vary depending on the requirements of a specific position and may include:

Username and password for your Recruitment System account.

Contact information (e.g., your name, home address, email address or phone number).

Information contained in your resume or CV, and other documents related to the application or recruitment process (e.g., cover letter, transcripts or certifications).

Information contained in your employment or social media site profile (e.g., LinkedIn, Monster), when you choose to share this with us.

References’ contact information (please keep in mind that it is your responsibility to obtain consent before providing us with the personal information of others).

Information about your visa status and authorization to work in the relevant jurisdiction.

Demographic information including age and gender, and where applicable and in accordance with applicable law, your ethnicity, disability or veteran status.

Information about your relationship with the Hearst family of companies, including prior work experience or association you may have with any current or former Hearst employees.

With your permission or as permitted by applicable law, information obtained through background checks.

Other information you may choose to submit to us in connection with your application or profile creation.

We may obtain this information directly from you or from third party agencies and recruiters if they submit an application through the Recruitment System on your behalf. If you are a third party agency, recruiter or other agent submitting information on behalf of an applicant, it is your responsibility to describe your privacy practices and obtain any requisite consent from the applicant before providing their information to us.

Information Automatically Collected

In addition, we and the cloud provider of the Recruitment System (Oracle Corporation) may automatically collect or log certain information about visits to and usage of the Recruitment System, using technologies such as cookies, server logs and web beacons. This information may include your Internet Protocol (IP) Address, technical information about browsers and devices used to access the Recruitment System, and information about crashes or other technical issues. This information is generally aggregated to analyze and improve the quality and reliability of the Recruitment System. This information is not used to make employment-related decisions. At this time, the Recruitment System is not designed to respond to “Do Not Track” signals or similar mechanisms from browsers as there is no common, industry-accepted standard for doing so.

How We Use Your Personal Information

We use the personal information obtained through the Recruitment System for the purposes of carrying out our application tracking and recruitment activities, including:

Creating and managing your Recruitment System account and job applications.

Assessing your skills, qualifications and interests against the position applied for or other positions within the Hearst family of companies.

Verifying your information, including through reference checks and, where applicable, background checks.

Communicating with you about the application and recruitment process, or sending you information about other positions within the Hearst family of companies which may be of interest to you.

Operating, evaluating and improving the Recruitment System, our application tracking and recruitment activities and communications (this includes analyzing our job applicant base and Talent Pool, analyzing our hiring practices or trends, identifying qualifications or skills shortages, and using information to match candidates and potential opportunities).

Detecting, preventing and responding to fraud or potentially illegal activities, misuse of the Recruitment System, intellectual property infringement or other violations of law, this Privacy Notice or other Hearst policies.

Performing audits, assessments, maintenance and testing or troubleshooting activities related to the Recruitment System.

Backing up our systems (including for disaster recovery purposes) and enhancing the overall security of the Recruitment System.

Complying with and enforcing applicable legal requirements (including legal processes such as court orders, warrants or subpoenas) and fulfilling our contractual obligations.

If you accept a job offer with Hearst, the information obtained through the Recruitment System and application process will become part of your employment record subject to applicable law.

With Whom We Share Your Personal Information

We may share the personal information we obtain through the Recruitment System in connection with our application tracking and recruitment activities, including:

With other companies within the Hearst family of companies. When you create a profile or submit an application through the Recruitment System, your information will be added to the Hearst talent pool (“Talent Pool”) and may be accessed by relevant staff within the Hearst family of companies.

With service providers we use in connection with the Recruitment System and the application and recruitment process. These service providers may access your personal information in connection with the services or features they provide on our behalf. For example, the Recruitment System is hosted by our cloud provider, Oracle Corporation.

With others when you direct us or consent to such sharing.

In addition, we may share your personal information as we believe is necessary or appropriate to protect, enforce, or defend our legal rights, the privacy or safety of our employees, users of the Recruitment System or other individuals and entities, or to comply with or enforce applicable legal requirements (including legal processes such as court orders, warrants or subpoenas) and fulfilling our contractual obligations.

We also reserve the right to transfer all information we have about you (including your personal information) in the event that we sell or transfer all or a portion of our business or assets to a third party, such as in the event of a merger, acquisition or other disposition or in connection with a bankruptcy reorganization, dissolution, or liquidation.

Accessing and Updating Your Personal Information

You may access the Recruitment System at any time to review or update the information you submitted in your account. Please note that you are responsible for ensuring your information is accurate and current.

If you no longer wish to be contacted about Hearst positions, please contact us as described below. Your profile information will no longer be used for our recruitment purposes, however, please bear in mind that some of your information may be retained as required or appropriate under applicable law, including for legal and auditing purposes.

How We Protect Your Personal Information

We maintain appropriate administrative, technical and physical safeguards designed to protect the personal information you provide against accidental, unlawful or unauthorized destruction, loss, alteration, access, disclosure or use. However, no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, while we make reasonable efforts to protect your personal information, Hearst cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Children

The Recruitment System is not intended for use by children, especially those under the age of 13, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 13.

Third Party Websites or Other Services, including Employment or Social Media Sites

You may choose to provide us with access to certain personal information maintained by third parties such as employment or social media sites (e.g., LinkedIn, Monster). The information we may receive varies by site and is controlled by the operator of the site and your privacy settings. By authorizing Hearst to have access to this information, you agree that Hearst may collect, store and use this information in accordance with this Privacy Notice. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of any non-Hearst operated websites, mobile apps or other digital services, including those that may be linked through the Recruitment System, and we encourage you to review the privacy policies or notices published thereon.

Changes to This Privacy Notice

This Privacy Notice may be updated periodically and without prior notice to you to reflect changes in our personal information practices. We will post a prominent notice within the Recruitment System to notify you of any material changes to this Privacy Notice. We indicate at the top of the Privacy Notice when it was most recently updated.

Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Notice, please contact us careersiteprivacy@hearst.com.

Verifying your information, including through reference checks.

Communicating with you about the application and recruitment process, or sending you information about other positions within the Hearst family of companies which may be of interest to you.

Operating, evaluating and improving the Recruitment System, our application tracking and recruitment activities and communications (this includes analyzing our job applicant base and Talent Pool, analyzing our hiring practices or trends, identifying qualifications or skills shortages, and using information to match candidates and potential opportunities).

Detecting, preventing and responding to fraud or potentially illegal activities, misuse of the Recruitment System, intellectual property infringement or other violations of law, this Privacy Notice or other Hearst policies.

Performing audits, assessments, maintenance and testing or troubleshooting activities related to the Recruitment System.

Backing up our systems (including for disaster recovery purposes) and enhancing the overall security of the Recruitment System.

Complying with and enforcing applicable legal requirements (including legal processes such as court orders, warrants or subpoenas) and fulfilling our contractual obligations.

Administration of our applications, software, and systems, including detection, prevention and investigation of security issues, outages, cyber and phishing attacks, fraud and/or other malicious, criminal or illegal activity.

Other purposes as part of our business activities when reasonably required by us.

Such other purposes as we may disclose to you from time to time.

If you accept a job offer with Hearst, the information obtained through the Recruitment System and application process will become part of your employment record subject to applicable law.
